channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Sponge bullets: 'No immediate plans' for frontline use - Police Commissioner
item.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster is adamant there are no plans for police to roll out the use of sponge rounds to frontline officers.

item.title: What went wrong with the Armed Response Team trial
item.description: The Detail - The scrapping of the pilot for police Armed Response Teams comes as a huge relief to advocates who spoke out against having more officers with guns.

item.title: South Island winter tomato growers hit by carbon charges
item.description: Parts of New Zealand might soon struggle to find tomatoes in winter - and that's due to the cost of emitting carbon.

item.title: KiwiRail defends troublesome diesel locomotives - and wants to buy more
item.description: KiwiRail says it has no choice but to buy more Chinese made diesel locomotives - even though they've been troublesome and unreliable for more than a decade.

item.title: Third school's students complain over Black Lives Matter poster removal
item.description: Two Christchurch Girls' High School students say their posters were removed last week by a staff member - who then told them that "all lives matter".

item.title: New stocktake reveals the hospital facilities in worst condition
item.description: A main tower block at Nelson Hospital and the special care baby unit at WaitÄkere Hospital are in the worst condition of any hospital buildings in New Zealand, a nationwide hospital stocktake shows.

item.title: Rimpac war games exercise: New Zealand government urged to withdraw
item.description: Peace activists say New Zealand should not send a ship to take part in a major war games exercise off the coast of Hawaii.

item.title: Murder victim was 'lamb to the slaughter' - partner
item.description: The murder of pregnant 21-year-old mother Angela Blackmoore in Christchurch in 1995 has been described as a cold-blooded execution.

item.title: Sponge bullets suggested by police commissioner 'incredibly dangerous' - lobby group
item.description: After axing Armed Response Teams, the Police Commissioner has suggested using "sponge bullets" - but opponents say there is no evidence to support the use of these potentially lethal weapons.

item.title: Marist College students unite over school's Black Lives Matter response
item.description: Checkpoint - The way Marist College has dealt with Black Lives Matter material is upsetting and pupils just want to be heard, the student who has stood down as its cultural leader says.

item.title: Bridget Simmonds disappearance: Concerns 'something sinister' happened
item.description: New information about Northland woman Bridget Simmonds, who went missing last February, has police gravely concerned, they say.

item.title: Pretend protesters to be used at naval training exercise
item.description: The Navy will carry out a four-day training exercise in Auckland this week - using actors to simulate a crowd of protesters.

item.title: Cannabis oil infused lollies, chocolates and baked goods seized by police
item.description: Police have seized lollies, chocolates and baked goods infused with cannabis oil from a Hamilton address after investigating production and distribution of edible cannabis products.

item.title: Elderly Aucklander who was hit by car named
item.description: Police have named the man who died after being hit by a car in Papatoetoe on Monday.

item.title: Police seek help with burglary of beauty spa
item.description: The police are seeking information from the public following a burglary in Nelson last month.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in NZ for 19th day in a row
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand and another significant cluster has now closed, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

item.title: Your employment questions answered: Wage subsidy, redundancy and what's next
item.description: Employment law experts Ashleigh Fechney and Simon Martin joined RNZ to answer your questions on the next set of issues facing employees and employers.

item.title: Council runs cost of Christchurch households' rogue rubbish habit
item.description: A campaign to stop Christchurch households from using their recycling bins to dump their smelly non-recyclable waste, is so far failing to change peoples' behaviour.
